member.summary: Creates a leaf condition node that represents a comparison of property value and constant value.
member.param: The name of a property to be compared, or null for an unspecified property. The locale name of the leaf node is LOCALE_NAME_USER_DEFAULT.
The constant value against which the property value should be compared.
Specific condition to be used when comparing the actual value and the expected value of the given property
member.returns: SearchCondition based on the given parameters
member.remarks: The search will only work for files that are indexed, as well as the specific properties are indexed. To find the properties that are indexed, look for the specific property's property description and property for IsQueryable flag.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.SearchConditionFactory.CreateAndOrCondition(Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.SearchConditionType,System.Boolean,Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.SearchCondition[])
member.summary: Creates a condition node that is a logical conjunction ("AND") or disjunction ("OR") of a collection of subconditions.
member.param: The SearchConditionType of the condition node. Must be either AndCondition or OrCondition.

TRUE to logically simplify the result, if possible; then the result will not necessarily to be of the specified kind. FALSE if the result should have exactly the prescribed structure. An application that plans to execute a query based on the condition tree would typically benefit from setting this parameter to TRUE.
Array of subconditions
member.returns: New SearchCondition based on the operation

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.SearchConditionFactory.CreateNotCondition(Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.SearchCondition,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a condition node that is a logical negation (NOT) of another condition (a subnode of this node).
member.param: SearchCondition node to be negated.
True to logically simplify the result if possible; False otherwise. In a query builder scenario, simplyfy should typically be set to false.
member.returns: New SearchCondition

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.ShellThumbnail.AllowBiggerSize
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines if the user can manually stretch the returned image. The default value is false.
member.remarks: For example, if the caller passes in 80x80 a 96x96 thumbnail could be returned. This could be used as a performance optimization if the caller will need to stretch the image themselves anyway. Note that the Shell implementation performs a GDI stretch blit. If the caller wants a higher quality image stretch, they should pass this flag and do it themselves.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.AccessModes
member.summary:
The STGM constants are flags that indicate conditions for creating and deleting the object and access modes for the object.
You can combine these flags, but you can only choose one flag from each group of related flags. Typically one flag from each of the access and sharing groups must be specified for all functions and methods which use these constants.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.AccessModes.Direct
member.summary: Indicates that, in direct mode, each change to a storage or stream element is written as it occurs.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.AccessModes.Transacted
member.summary: Indicates that, in transacted mode, changes are buffered and written only if an explicit commit operation is called.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.AccessModes.Simple
member.summary: Provides a faster implementation of a compound file in a limited, but frequently used, case.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.AccessModes.Read
member.summary: Indicates that the object is read-only, meaning that modifications cannot be made.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.AccessModes.Write
member.summary: Enables you to save changes to the object, but does not permit access to its data.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.AccessModes.ReadWrite
member.summary: Enables access and modification of object data.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.AccessModes.ShareDenyNone
member.summary: Specifies that subsequent openings of the object are not denied read or write access.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.AccessModes.ShareDenyRead
member.summary: Prevents others from subsequently opening the object in Read mode.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.AccessModes.ShareDenyWrite
member.summary: Prevents others from subsequently opening the object for Write or ReadWrite access.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.AccessModes.ShareExclusive
member.summary: Prevents others from subsequently opening the object in any mode.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.AccessModes.Priority
member.summary: Opens the storage object with exclusive access to the most recently committed version.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.AccessModes.DeleteOnRelease
member.summary: Indicates that the underlying file is to be automatically destroyed when the root storage object is released. This feature is most useful for creating temporary files.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.AccessModes.NoScratch
member.summary: Indicates that, in transacted mode, a temporary scratch file is usually used to save modifications until the Commit method is called. Specifying NoScratch permits the unused portion of the original file to be used as work space instead of creating a new file for that purpose.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.AccessModes.Create
member.summary: Indicates that an existing storage object or stream should be removed before the new object replaces it.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.AccessModes.Convert
member.summary: Creates the new object while preserving existing data in a stream named "Contents".

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.AccessModes.FailIfThere
member.summary: Causes the create operation to fail if an existing object with the specified name exists.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.AccessModes.NoSnapshot
member.summary: This flag is used when opening a storage object with Transacted and without ShareExclusive or ShareDenyWrite. In this case, specifying NoSnapshot prevents the system-provided implementation from creating a snapshot copy of the file. Instead, changes to the file are written to the end of the file.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.AccessModes.DirectSingleWriterMultipleReader
member.summary: Supports direct mode for single-writer, multireader file operations.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.StockIconsNativeMethods.StockIconOptions
member.summary: Specifies options for the appearance of the stock icon.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.StockIconsNativeMethods.StockIconOptions.Large
member.summary: Retrieve the small version of the icon, as specified by SM_CXICON and SM_CYICON system metrics.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.StockIconsNativeMethods.StockIconOptions.Small
member.summary: Retrieve the small version of the icon, as specified by SM_CXSMICON and SM_CYSMICON system metrics.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.StockIconsNativeMethods.StockIconOptions.ShellSize
member.summary: Retrieve the shell-sized icons (instead of the size specified by the system metrics).

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.StockIconsNativeMethods.StockIconOptions.Handle
member.summary: Specified that the hIcon member of the SHSTOCKICONINFO structure receives a handle to the specified icon.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.StockIconsNativeMethods.StockIconOptions.SystemIndex
member.summary: Specifies that the iSysImageImage member of the SHSTOCKICONINFO structure receives the index of the specified icon in the system imagelist.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.StockIconsNativeMethods.StockIconOptions.LinkOverlay
member.summary: Adds the link overlay to the icon.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.StockIconsNativeMethods.StockIconOptions.Selected
member.summary: Adds the system highlight color to the icon.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.WindowStyles.Border
member.summary: The window has a thin-line border.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.WindowStyles.Caption
member.summary: The window has a title bar (includes the WS_BORDER style).

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.WindowStyles.Child
member.summary: The window is a child window. A window with this style cannot have a menu bar. This style cannot be used with the WS_POPUP style.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.WindowStyles.ChildWindow
member.summary: Same as the WS_CHILD style.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.WindowStyles.ClipChildren
member.summary: Excludes the area occupied by child windows when drawing occurs within the parent window. This style is used when creating the parent window.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.WindowStyles.ClipSiblings
member.summary: Clips child windows relative to each other; that is, when a particular child window receives a WM_PAINT message, the WS_CLIPSIBLINGS style clips all other overlapping child windows out of the region of the child window to be updated. If WS_CLIPSIBLINGS is not specified and child windows overlap, it is possible, when drawing within the client area of a child window, to draw within the client area of a neighboring child window.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.WindowStyles.Disabled
member.summary: The window is initially disabled. A disabled window cannot receive input from the user. To change this after a window has been created, use the EnableWindow function.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.WindowStyles.DialogFrame
member.summary: The window has a border of a style typically used with dialog boxes. A window with this style cannot have a title bar.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.WindowStyles.Group
member.summary:
The window is the first control of a group of controls. The group consists of this first control and all controls defined after it, up to the next control with the WS_GROUP style. The first control in each group usually has the WS_TABSTOP style so that the user can move from group to group. The user can subsequently change the keyboard focus from one control in the group to the next control in the group by using the direction keys.
You can turn this style on and off to change dialog box navigation. To change this style after a window has been created, use the SetWindowLong function.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.WindowStyles.HorizontalScroll
member.summary: The window has a horizontal scroll bar.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.WindowStyles.Iconic
member.summary: The window is initially minimized. Same as the WS_MINIMIZE style.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.WindowStyles.Maximize
member.summary: The window is initially maximized.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.WindowStyles.MaximizeBox
member.summary: The window has a maximize button. Cannot be combined with the WS_EX_CONTEXTHELP style. The WS_SYSMENU style must also be specifie

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.WindowStyles.Minimize
member.summary: The window is initially minimized. Same as the WS_ICONIC style.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.WindowStyles.MinimizeBox
member.summary: The window has a minimize button. Cannot be combined with the WS_EX_CONTEXTHELP style. The WS_SYSMENU style must also be specified.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.WindowStyles.Overlapped
member.summary: The window is an overlapped window. An overlapped window has a title bar and a border. Same as the WS_TILED style.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.WindowStyles.Popup
member.summary: The windows is a pop-up window. This style cannot be used with the WS_CHILD style.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.WindowStyles.SizeBox
member.summary: The window has a sizing border. Same as the WS_THICKFRAME style.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.WindowStyles.SystemMenu
member.summary: The window has a window menu on its title bar. The WS_CAPTION style must also be specified.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.WindowStyles.Tabstop
member.summary:
The window is a control that can receive the keyboard focus when the user presses the TAB key. Pressing the TAB key changes the keyboard focus to the next control with the WS_TABSTOP style.
You can turn this style on and off to change dialog box navigation. To change this style after a window has been created, use the SetWindowLong function. For user-created windows and modeless dialogs to work with tab stops, alter the message loop to call the IsDialogMessage function.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.WindowStyles.ThickFrame
member.summary: The window has a sizing border. Same as the WS_SIZEBOX style.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.WindowStyles.Tiled
member.summary: The window is an overlapped window. An overlapped window has a title bar and a border. Same as the WS_OVERLAPPED style.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.WindowStyles.Visible
member.summary:
The window is initially visible.
This style can be turned on and off by using the ShowWindow or SetWindowPos function.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.WindowStyles.VerticalScroll
member.summary: The window has a vertical scroll bar.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.WindowStyles.TiledWindowMask
member.summary: The window is an overlapped window. Same as the WS_OVERLAPPEDWINDOW style.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.WindowStyles.PopupWindowMask
member.summary: The window is a pop-up window. The WS_CAPTION and WS_POPUPWINDOW styles must be combined to make the window menu visible.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.WindowStyles.OverlappedWindowMask
member.summary: The window is an overlapped window. Same as the WS_TILEDWINDOW style.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Controls.IExplorerBrowser.Initialize(System.IntPtr,Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.NativeRect@,Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Controls.FolderSettings)
member.summary: Prepares the browser to be navigated.
member.param: A handle to the owner window or control.

A pointer to a RECT containing the coordinates of the bounding rectangle the browser will occupy. The coordinates are relative to hwndParent. If this parameter is NULL, then method IExplorerBrowser::SetRect should subsequently be called.

A pointer to a FOLDERSETTINGS structure that determines how the folder will be displayed in the view. If this parameter is NULL, then method IExplorerBrowser::SetFolderSettings should be called, otherwise, the default view settings for the folder are used.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Controls.IExplorerBrowser.Destroy
member.summary: Destroys the browser.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Controls.IExplorerBrowser.SetRect(System.IntPtr@,Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.NativeRect)
member.summary: Sets the size and position of the view windows created by the browser.
member.param: A pointer to a DeferWindowPos handle. This paramater can be NULL.
The coordinates that the browser will occupy.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Controls.IExplorerBrowser.SetPropertyBag(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the name of the property bag.
member.param: A pointer to a constant, null-terminated, Unicode string that contains the name of the property bag. View state information that is specific to the application of the client is stored (persisted) using this name.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Controls.IExplorerBrowser.SetEmptyText(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the default empty text.
member.param: A pointer to a constant, null-terminated, Unicode string that contains the empty text.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Controls.IExplorerBrowser.SetFolderSettings(Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Controls.FolderSettings)
member.summary: Sets the folder settings for the current view.
member.param: A pointer to a FOLDERSETTINGS structure that contains the folder settings to be applied.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Controls.IExplorerBrowser.Advise(System.IntPtr,System.UInt32@)
member.summary: Initiates a connection with IExplorerBrowser for event callbacks.
member.param: A pointer to the IExplorerBrowserEvents interface of the object to be advised of IExplorerBrowser events
When this method returns, contains a token that uniquely identifies the event listener. This allows several event listeners to be subscribed at a time.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Controls.IExplorerBrowser.Unadvise(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Terminates an advisory connection.
member.param: A connection token previously returned from IExplorerBrowser::Advise. Identifies the connection to be terminated.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Controls.IExplorerBrowser.SetOptions(Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Controls.ExplorerBrowserOptions)
member.summary: Sets the current browser options.
member.param: One or more EXPLORER_BROWSER_OPTIONS flags to be set.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Controls.IExplorerBrowser.GetOptions(Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Controls.ExplorerBrowserOptions@)
member.summary: Gets the current browser options.
member.param: When this method returns, contains the current EXPLORER_BROWSER_OPTIONS for the browser.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Controls.IExplorerBrowser.BrowseToIDList(System.IntPtr,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Browses to a pointer to an item identifier list (PIDL)
member.param: A pointer to a const ITEMIDLIST (item identifier list) that specifies an object's location as the destination to navigate to. This parameter can be NULL.
A flag that specifies the category of the pidl. This affects how navigation is accomplished

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Controls.IExplorerBrowser.BrowseToObject(System.Object,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Browse to an object
member.param: A pointer to an object to browse to. If the object cannot be browsed, an error value is returned.
A flag that specifies the category of the pidl. This affects how navigation is accomplished.

member.summary: Creates a results folder and fills it with items.

One of the EXPLORER_BROWSER_FILL_FLAGS

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Controls.IExplorerBrowser.RemoveAll
member.summary: Removes all items from the results folder.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Controls.IExplorerBrowser.GetCurrentView(System.Guid@,System.IntPtr@)
member.summary: Gets an interface for the current view of the browser.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.DefinitionOptions
member.summary: Specifies behaviors for known folders.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.DefinitionOptions.None
member.summary: No behaviors are defined.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.DefinitionOptions.LocalRedirectOnly
member.summary: Prevents a per-user known folder from being redirected to a network location.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.DefinitionOptions.Roamable
member.summary: The known folder can be roamed through PC-to-PC synchronization.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.DefinitionOptions.Precreate
member.summary: Creates the known folder when the user first logs on.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.FolderCategory
member.summary: Specifies the categories for known folders.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.FolderCategory.None
member.summary: The folder category is not specified.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.FolderCategory.Virtual
member.summary: The folder is a virtual folder. Virtual folders are not part of the file system. For example, Control Panel and Printers are virtual folders. A number of properties such as folder path and redirection do not apply to this category.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.FolderCategory.Fixed
member.summary: The folder is fixed. Fixed file system folders are not managed by the Shell and are usually given a permanent path when the system is installed. For example, the Windows and Program Files folders are fixed folders. A number of properties such as redirection do not apply to this category.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.FolderCategory.Common
member.summary: The folder is a common folder. Common folders are used for sharing data and settings accessible by all users of a system. For example, all users share a common Documents folder as well as their per-user Documents folder.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.FolderCategory.PerUser
member.summary: Each user has their own copy of the folder. Per-user folders are those stored under each user's profile and accessible only by that user.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.FolderProperties
member.summary: Structure used internally to store property values for a known folder. This structure holds the information returned in the FOLDER_DEFINITION structure, and resources referenced by fields in NativeFolderDefinition, such as icon and tool tip.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.FolderTypes
member.summary: The FolderTypes values represent a view template applied to a folder, usually based on its intended use and contents.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.FolderTypes.NotSpecified
member.summary: No particular content type has been detected or specified. This value is not supported in Windows 7 and later systems.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.FolderTypes.Invalid
member.summary: The folder is invalid. There are several things that can cause this judgement: hard disk errors, file system errors, and compression errors among them.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.FolderTypes.Documents
member.summary: The folder contains document files. These can be of mixed format.doc, .txt, and others.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.FolderTypes.Pictures
member.summary: Image files, such as .jpg, .tif, or .png files.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.FolderTypes.Music
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. The folder contains audio files, such as .mp3 and .wma files.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.FolderTypes.MusicIcons
member.summary: A list of music files displayed in Icons view. This value is not supported in Windows 7 and later systems.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.FolderTypes.Games
member.summary: The folder is the Games folder found in the Start menu.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.FolderTypes.ControlPanelCategory
member.summary: The Control Panel in category view. This is a virtual folder.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.FolderTypes.ControlPanelClassic
member.summary: The Control Panel in classic view. This is a virtual folder.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.FolderTypes.Printers
member.summary: Printers that have been added to the system. This is a virtual folder.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.FolderTypes.RecycleBin
member.summary: The Recycle Bin. This is a virtual folder.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.FolderTypes.SoftwareExplorer
member.summary: The software explorer window used by the Add or Remove Programs control panel icon.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.FolderTypes.CompressedFolder
member.summary: The folder is a compressed archive, such as a compressed file with a .zip file name extension.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.FolderTypes.Contacts
member.summary: An e-mail-related folder that contains contact information.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.FolderTypes.Library
member.summary: A default library view without a more specific template. This value is not supported in Windows 7 and later systems.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.FolderTypes.NetworkExplorer
member.summary: The Network Explorer folder.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.FolderTypes.UserFiles
member.summary: The folder is the FOLDERID_UsersFiles folder.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.FolderTypes.GenericSearchResults
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. The folder contains search results, but they are of mixed or no specific type.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.FolderTypes.GenericLibrary
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. The folder is a library, but of no specified type.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.FolderTypes.Videos
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. The folder contains video files. These can be of mixed format.wmv, .mov, and others.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.FolderTypes.UsersLibraries
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. The view shown when the user clicks the Windows Explorer button on the taskbar.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.FolderTypes.OtherUsers
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. The homegroup view.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.FolderTypes.Communications
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. A folder that contains communication-related files such as e-mails, calendar information, and contact information.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.FolderTypes.RecordedTV
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. The folder contains recorded television broadcasts.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.FolderTypes.SavedGames
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. The folder contains saved game states.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.FolderTypes.OpenSearch
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. The folder contains federated search OpenSearch results.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.FolderTypes.SearchConnector
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. Before you search.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.FolderTypes.Searches
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. A user's Searches folder, normally found at C:\Users\username\Searches.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.KnownFolderHelper
member.summary: Creates the helper class for known folders.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.KnownFolderHelper.FromPIDL(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Returns the native known folder (IKnownFolderNative) given a PID list

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.KnownFolderHelper.FromKnownFolderId(System.Guid)
member.summary: Returns a known folder given a globally unique identifier.
member.param: A GUID for the requested known folder.
member.returns: A known folder representing the specified name.
member.exception: Thrown if the given Known Folder ID is invalid.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.KnownFolderHelper.FromKnownFolderIdInternal(System.Guid)
member.summary: Returns a known folder given a globally unique identifier.
member.param: A GUID for the requested known folder.
member.returns: A known folder representing the specified name. Returns null if Known Folder is not found or could not be created.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.KnownFolderHelper.GetKnownFolder(Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.IKnownFolderNative)
member.summary: Given a native KnownFolder (IKnownFolderNative), create the right type of IKnownFolder object (FileSystemKnownFolder or NonFileSystemKnownFolder)
member.param: Native Known Folder

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.KnownFolderHelper.FromCanonicalName(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the known folder given its canonical name.
member.param: A non-localized canonical name for the known folder, such as MyComputer.
member.returns: A known folder representing the specified name.
member.exception: Thrown if the given canonical name is invalid or if the KnownFolder could not be created.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.KnownFolderHelper.FromPath(System.String)
member.summary: Returns a known folder given its shell path, such as C:\users\public\documents or ::{645FF040-5081-101B-9F08-00AA002F954E} for the Recycle Bin.
member.param: The path for the requested known folder; either a physical path or a virtual path.
member.returns: A known folder representing the specified name.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.KnownFolderHelper.FromParsingName(System.String)
member.summary: Returns a known folder given its shell namespace parsing name, such as ::{645FF040-5081-101B-9F08-00AA002F954E} for the Recycle Bin.
member.param: The parsing name (or path) for the requested known folder.
member.returns: A known folder representing the specified name.
member.exception: Thrown if the given parsing name is invalid.

member.summary: The value of the property must begin with the value of the constant.

member.summary: The value of the property must contain the value of the constant.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.SearchConditionOperation.DosWildcards
member.summary: The value of the property must match the value of the constant, where '?' matches any single character and '*' matches any sequence of characters.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.StructuredQuerySingleOption
member.summary: Provides a set of flags to be used with IQueryParser::SetOption and IQueryParser::GetOption to indicate individual options.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.StructuredQuerySingleOption.Schema
member.summary: The value should be VT_LPWSTR and the path to a file containing a schema binary.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.StructuredQuerySingleOption.Locale
member.summary: The value must be VT_EMPTY (the default) or a VT_UI4 that is an LCID. It is used as the locale of contents (not keywords) in the query to be searched for, when no other information is available. The default value is the current keyboard locale. Retrieving the value always returns a VT_UI4.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.StructuredQuerySingleOption.WordBreaker
member.summary: This option is used to override the default word breaker used when identifying keywords in queries. The default word breaker is chosen according to the language of the keywords (cf. SQSO_LANGUAGE_KEYWORDS below). When setting this option, the value should be VT_EMPTY for using the default word breaker, or a VT_UNKNOWN with an object supporting the IWordBreaker interface. Retrieving the option always returns a VT_UNKNOWN with an object supporting the IWordBreaker interface.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.StructuredQuerySingleOption.NaturalSyntax
member.summary: The value should be VT_EMPTY or VT_BOOL with VARIANT_TRUE to allow natural query syntax (the default) or VT_BOOL with VARIANT_FALSE to allow only advanced query syntax. Retrieving the option always returns a VT_BOOL. This option is now deprecated, use SQSO_SYNTAX.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.StructuredQuerySingleOption.AutomaticWildcard
member.summary: The value should be VT_BOOL with VARIANT_TRUE to generate query expressions as if each word in the query had a star appended to it (unless followed by punctuation other than a parenthesis), or VT_EMPTY or VT_BOOL with VARIANT_FALSE to use the words as they are (the default). A word-wheeling application will generally want to set this option to true. Retrieving the option always returns a VT_BOOL.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.StructuredQuerySingleOption.TraceLevel
member.summary: Reserved. The value should be VT_EMPTY (the default) or VT_I4. Retrieving the option always returns a VT_I4.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.StructuredQuerySingleOption.LanguageKeywords
member.summary: The value must be a VT_UI4 that is a LANGID. It defaults to the default user UI language.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.StructuredQuerySingleOption.Syntax
member.summary: The value must be a VT_UI4 that is a STRUCTURED_QUERY_SYNTAX value. It defaults to SQS_NATURAL_QUERY_SYNTAX.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.StructuredQuerySingleOption.TimeZone
member.summary: The value must be a VT_BLOB that is a copy of a TIME_ZONE_INFORMATION structure. It defaults to the current time zone.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.StructuredQuerySingleOption.ImplicitConnector
member.summary: This setting decides what connector should be assumed between conditions when none is specified. The value must be a VT_UI4 that is a CONDITION_TYPE. Only CT_AND_CONDITION and CT_OR_CONDITION are valid. It defaults to CT_AND_CONDITION.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.StructuredQuerySingleOption.ConnectorCase
member.summary: This setting decides whether there are special requirements on the case of connector keywords (such as AND or OR). The value must be a VT_UI4 that is a CASE_REQUIREMENT value. It defaults to CASE_REQUIREMENT_UPPER_IF_AQS.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.StructuredQueryMultipleOption
member.summary: Provides a set of flags to be used with IQueryParser::SetMultiOption to indicate individual options.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.StructuredQueryMultipleOption.VirtualProperty
member.summary: The key should be property name P. The value should be a VT_UNKNOWN with an IEnumVARIANT which has two values: a VT_BSTR that is another property name Q and a VT_I4 that is a CONDITION_OPERATION cop. A predicate with property name P, some operation and a value V will then be replaced by a predicate with property name Q, operation cop and value V before further processing happens.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.StructuredQueryMultipleOption.DefaultProperty
member.summary: The key should be a value type name V. The value should be a VT_LPWSTR with a property name P. A predicate with no property name and a value of type V (or any subtype of V) will then use property P.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.StructuredQueryMultipleOption.GeneratorForType
member.summary: The key should be a value type name V. The value should be a VT_UNKNOWN with a IConditionGenerator G. The GenerateForLeaf method of G will then be applied to any predicate with value type V and if it returns a query expression, that will be used. If it returns NULL, normal processing will be used instead.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.StructuredQueryMultipleOption.MapProperty
member.summary: The key should be a property name P. The value should be a VT_VECTOR|VT_LPWSTR, where each string is a property name. The count must be at least one. This "map" will be added to those of the loaded schema and used during resolution. A second call with the same key will replace the current map. If the value is VT_NULL, the map will be removed.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.QueryParserManagerOption
member.summary: Used by IQueryParserManager::SetOption to set parsing options. This can be used to specify schemas and localization options.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.QueryParserManagerOption.SchemaBinaryName
member.summary: A VT_LPWSTR containing the name of the file that contains the schema binary. The default value is StructuredQuerySchema.bin for the SystemIndex catalog and StructuredQuerySchemaTrivial.bin for the trivial catalog.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.QueryParserManagerOption.PreLocalizedSchemaBinaryPath
member.summary: Either a VT_BOOL or a VT_LPWSTR. If the value is a VT_BOOL and is FALSE, a pre-localized schema will not be used. If the value is a VT_BOOL and is TRUE, IQueryParserManager will use the pre-localized schema binary in "%ALLUSERSPROFILE%\Microsoft\Windows". If the value is a VT_LPWSTR, the value should contain the full path of the folder in which the pre-localized schema binary can be found. The default value is VT_BOOL with TRUE.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.QueryParserManagerOption.UnlocalizedSchemaBinaryPath
member.summary: A VT_LPWSTR containing the full path to the folder that contains the unlocalized schema binary. The default value is "%SYSTEMROOT%\System32".

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.QueryParserManagerOption.LocalizedSchemaBinaryPath
member.summary: A VT_LPWSTR containing the full path to the folder that contains the localized schema binary that can be read and written to as needed. The default value is "%LOCALAPPDATA%\Microsoft\Windows".

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.QueryParserManagerOption.AppendLCIDToLocalizedPath
member.summary: A VT_BOOL. If TRUE, then the paths for pre-localized and localized binaries have "\(LCID)" appended to them, where language code identifier (LCID) is the decimal locale ID for the localized language. The default is TRUE.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.QueryParserManagerOption.LocalizerSupport
member.summary: A VT_UNKNOWN with an object supporting ISchemaLocalizerSupport. This object will be used instead of the default localizer support object.

member.summary: Sets an item to appear as the initial entry in a Save As dialog.
member.param: The initial entry to be set in the dialog.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Dialogs.CommonSaveFileDialog.SetCollectedPropertyKeys(System.Boolean,Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.PropertySystem.PropertyKey[])
member.summary: Specifies which properties will be collected in the save dialog.
member.param: True to show default properties for the currently selected filetype in addition to the properties specified by propertyList. False to show only properties specified by pList. List of properties to collect. This parameter can be null.
member.remarks: SetCollectedPropertyKeys can be called at any time before the dialog is displayed or while it is visible. If different properties are to be collected depending on the chosen filetype, then SetCollectedProperties can be called in response to CommonFileDialog::FileTypeChanged event. Note: By default, no properties are collected in the save dialog.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Dialogs.CommonSaveFileDialog.OverwritePrompt
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that controls whether to prompt before overwriting an existing file of the same name. Default value is true.
member.permission: This property cannot be changed when the dialog is showing.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Dialogs.CommonSaveFileDialog.CreatePrompt
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that controls whether to prompt for creation if the item returned in the save dialog does not exist.
member.remarks: Note that this does not actually create the item.
member.permission: This property cannot be changed when the dialog is showing.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Dialogs.CommonSaveFileDialog.IsExpandedMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that controls whether to the save dialog displays in expanded mode.
member.remarks: Expanded mode controls whether the dialog shows folders for browsing or hides them.
member.permission: This property cannot be changed when the dialog is showing.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Dialogs.CommonSaveFileDialog.AlwaysAppendDefaultExtension
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that controls whether the returned file name has a file extension that matches the currently selected file type. If necessary, the dialog appends the correct file extension.
member.permission: This property cannot be changed when the dialog is showing.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Dialogs.CommonSaveFileDialog.CollectedProperties
member.summary: Retrieves the set of property values for a saved item or an item in the process of being saved.
member.returns: Collection of property values collected from the save dialog
member.remarks: This property can be called while the dialog is showing to retrieve the current set of values in the metadata collection pane. It can also be called after the dialog has closed, to retrieve the final set of values. The call to this method will fail unless property collection has been turned on with a call to SetCollectedPropertyKeys method.

summary.para: Description: Hash to determine acquisition session.
Type: String -- VT_LPWSTR (For variants: VT_BSTR) Legacy code may treat this as VT_LPSTR.
Type: Multivalue String -- VT_VECTOR | VT_LPWSTR (For variants: VT_ARRAY | VT_BSTR) Legacy code may treat this as VT_LPSTR.
Description: The amount of total space in bytes.
Description: Legacy code treats this as VT_LPSTR.
Type: Multivalue String -- VT_VECTOR | VT_LPWSTR (For variants: VT_ARRAY | VT_BSTR)
Type: String -- VT_LPWSTR (For variants: VT_BSTR) Legacy code may treat this as VT_LPSTR.

Description: The list of type of items, this item contains. For example, this item contains urls, attachments etc. This is represented as a vector array of GUIDs where each GUID represents certain type.
Type: Multivalue Guid -- VT_VECTOR | VT_CLSID (For variants: VT_ARRAY | VT_CLSID)
Description: The time of the last access to the item. The Indexing Service friendly name is 'access'.

Description: The time the file entered the system via acquisition. This is not the same as System.DateImported. Examples are when pictures are acquired from a camera, or when music is purchased online.
Description: The date and time the item was created. The Indexing Service friendly name is 'create'.
Description: The time the file is imported into a separate database. This is not the same as System.DateAcquired. (Eg, 2003:05:22 13:55:04)
Description: The date and time of the last write to the item. The Indexing Service friendly name is 'write'.
Description: The contents of a SHDESCRIPTIONID structure as a buffer of bytes.
Type: Buffer -- VT_VECTOR | VT_UI1 (For variants: VT_ARRAY | VT_UI1)
Description: This is the WIN32_FIND_DATA dwFileAttributes for the file-based item.
Description: This is a user-friendly description of the file.

Description: This is the file extension of the file based item, including the leading period.
If System.FileName is VT_EMPTY, then this property should be too. Otherwise, it should be derived appropriately by the data source from System.FileName. If System.FileName does not have a file extension, this value should be VT_EMPTY.
To obtain the type of any item (including an item that is not a file), use System.ItemType.
Example values:
If the path is... The property value is... ----------------- ------------------------ "c:\foo\bar\hello.txt" ".txt" "\\server\share\mydir\goodnews.doc" ".doc" "\\server\share\numbers.xls" ".xls" "\\server\share\folder" VT_EMPTY "c:\foo\MyFolder" VT_EMPTY [desktop] VT_EMPTY

Description: This is the unique file ID, also known as the File Reference Number. For a given file, this is the same value as is found in the structure variable FILE_ID_BOTH_DIR_INFO.FileId, via GetFileInformationByHandleEx().

Description: This is the file name (including extension) of the file.
It is possible that the item might not exist on a filesystem (ie, it may not be opened using CreateFile). Nonetheless, if the item is represented as a file from the logical sense (and its name follows standard Win32 file-naming syntax), then the data source should emit this property.
If an item is not a file, then the value for this property is VT_EMPTY. See System.ItemNameDisplay.
This has the same value as System.ParsingName for items that are provided by the Shell's file folder.
Example values:
If the path is... The property value is... ----------------- ------------------------ "c:\foo\bar\hello.txt" "hello.txt" "\\server\share\mydir\goodnews.doc" "goodnews.doc" "\\server\share\numbers.xls" "numbers.xls" "c:\foo\MyFolder" "MyFolder" (email message) VT_EMPTY (song on portable device) "song.wma"
Description: This is the owner of the file, according to the file system.
Description: WIN32_FIND_DATAW in buffer of bytes.
Type: Buffer -- VT_VECTOR | VT_UI1 (For variants: VT_ARRAY | VT_UI1)
Description: This is the user-friendly form of System.FlagColor. Not intended to be parsed programmatically.
Description: Status of Flag. Values: (0=none 1=white 2=Red). cdoPR_FLAG_STATUS
Description: This is the user-friendly form of System.FlagStatus. Not intended to be parsed programmatically.
Description: The amount of free space in bytes.

Description: This PKEY is used to specify search terms that should be applied as broadly as possible, across all valid properties for the data source(s) being searched. It should not be emitted from a data source.
Type: Multivalue String -- VT_VECTOR | VT_LPWSTR (For variants: VT_ARRAY | VT_BSTR)
Description: This is the user-friendly form of System.Importance. Not intended to be parsed programmatically.
Description: The text (with formatted property values) to show in the infotip.
Description: Identifies if this item is an attachment.
Description: Identifies the default save location for a library for non-owners of the library
Description: Identifies the default save location for a library for the owner of the library
Description: Identifies if the message was not completely received for some error condition.
Description: A bool value to know if a location is supported (locally indexable, or remotely indexed).
Description: A bool value to know if a shell folder is pinned to the navigation pane
Description: Has the item been read?
Description: Identifies if a location or a library is search only
Description: Provided by certain shell folders. Return TRUE if the folder is a valid Send To target.
Description: Is this item shared? This only checks for ACLs that are not inherited.

Description: This is the generic list of authors associated with an item.
For example, the artist name for a track is the item author.
Type: Multivalue String -- VT_VECTOR | VT_LPWSTR (For variants: VT_ARRAY | VT_BSTR)

Description: This is the main date for an item. The date of interest.
For example, for photos this maps to System.Photo.DateTaken.

Description: This is the user-friendly display name of the parent folder of an item.
If System.ItemFolderPathDisplay is VT_EMPTY, then this property should be too. Otherwise, it should be derived appropriately by the data source from System.ItemFolderPathDisplay.
If the folder is a file folder, the value will be localized if a localized name is available.
Example values:
If the path is... The property value is... ----------------- ------------------------ "c:\foo\bar\hello.txt" "bar" "\\server\share\mydir\goodnews.doc" "mydir" "\\server\share\numbers.xls" "share" "c:\foo\MyFolder" "foo" "/Mailbox Account/Inbox/'Re: Hello!'" "Inbox"

Description: This is the user-friendly display path of the parent folder of an item.
If System.ItemPathDisplay is VT_EMPTY, then this property should be too. Otherwise, it should be derived appropriately by the data source from System.ItemPathDisplay.
Example values:
If the path is... The property value is... ----------------- ------------------------ "c:\foo\bar\hello.txt" "c:\foo\bar" "\\server\share\mydir\goodnews.doc" "\\server\share\mydir" "\\server\share\numbers.xls" "\\server\share" "c:\foo\MyFolder" "c:\foo" "/Mailbox Account/Inbox/'Re: Hello!'" "/Mailbox Account/Inbox"

Description: This is the user-friendly display path of the parent folder of an item. The format of the string should be tailored such that the folder name comes first, to optimize for a narrow viewing column.
If the folder is a file folder, the value includes localized names if they are present.
If System.ItemFolderPathDisplay is VT_EMPTY, then this property should be too. Otherwise, it should be derived appropriately by the data source from System.ItemFolderPathDisplay.
Example values:
If the path is... The property value is... ----------------- ------------------------ "c:\foo\bar\hello.txt" "bar (c:\foo)" "\\server\share\mydir\goodnews.doc" "mydir (\\server\share)" "\\server\share\numbers.xls" "share (\\server)" "c:\foo\MyFolder" "foo (c:\)" "/Mailbox Account/Inbox/'Re: Hello!'" "Inbox (/Mailbox Account)"

Description: This is the base-name of the System.ItemNameDisplay.
If the item is a file this property includes the extension in all cases, and will be localized if a localized name is available.
If the item is a message, then the value of this property does not include the forwarding or reply prefixes (see System.ItemNamePrefix).

Description: This is the display name in "most complete" form. This is the best effort unique representation of the name of an item that makes sense for end users to read. It is the concatentation of System.ItemNamePrefix and System.ItemName.
If the item is a file this property includes the extension in all cases, and will be localized if a localized name is available.
There are acceptable cases when System.FileName is not VT_EMPTY, yet the value of this property is completely different. Email messages are a key example. If the item is an email message, the item name is likely the subject. In that case, the value must be the concatenation of the System.ItemNamePrefix and System.ItemName. Since the value of System.ItemNamePrefix excludes any trailing whitespace, the concatenation must include a whitespace when generating System.ItemNameDisplay.
Note that this property is not guaranteed to be unique, but the idea is to promote the most likely candidate that can be unique and also makes sense for end users. For example, for documents, you might think about using System.Title as the System.ItemNameDisplay, but in practice the title of the documents may not be useful or unique enough to be of value as the sole System.ItemNameDisplay. Instead, providing the value of System.FileName as the value of System.ItemNameDisplay is a better candidate. In Windows Mail, the emails are stored in the file system as .eml files and the System.FileName for those files are not human-friendly as they contain GUIDs. In this example, promoting System.Subject as System.ItemNameDisplay makes more sense.
Compatibility notes:
Shell folder implementations on Vista: use PKEY_ItemNameDisplay for the name column when you want Explorer to call ISF::GetDisplayNameOf(SHGDN_NORMAL) to get the value of the name. Use another PKEY (like PKEY_ItemName) when you want Explorer to call either the folder's property store or ISF2::GetDetailsEx in order to get the value of the name.
Shell folder implementations on XP: the first column needs to be the name column, and Explorer will call ISF::GetDisplayNameOf to get the value of the name. The PKEY/SCID does not matter.
Example values:
File: "hello.txt" Message: "Re: Let's talk about Tom's argyle socks!" Device folder: "song.wma" Folder: "Documents"

Description: This is the prefix of an item, used for email messages. where the subject begins with "Re:" which is the prefix.
If the item is a file, then the value of this property is VT_EMPTY.
If the item is a message, then the value of this property is the forwarding or reply prefixes (including delimiting colon, but no whitespace), or VT_EMPTY if there is no prefix.
Example values:
System.ItemNamePrefix System.ItemName System.ItemNameDisplay --------------------- ------------------- ---------------------- VT_EMPTY "Great day" "Great day" "Re:" "Great day" "Re: Great day" "Fwd: " "Monthly budget" "Fwd: Monthly budget" VT_EMPTY "accounts.xls" "accounts.xls"

Description: This is the generic list of people associated with an item and who contributed to the item.
For example, this is the combination of people in the To list, Cc list and sender of an email message.
Type: Multivalue String -- VT_VECTOR | VT_LPWSTR (For variants: VT_ARRAY | VT_BSTR)

Description: This is the user-friendly display path to the item.
If the item is a file or folder this property includes the extension in all cases, and will be localized if a localized name is available.
For other items,this is the user-friendly equivalent, assuming the item exists in hierarchical storage.
Unlike System.ItemUrl, this property value does not include the URL scheme.
To parse an item path, use System.ItemUrl or System.ParsingPath. To reference shell namespace items using shell APIs, use System.ParsingPath.
Example values:
If the path is... The property value is... ----------------- ------------------------ "c:\foo\bar\hello.txt" "c:\foo\bar\hello.txt" "\\server\share\mydir\goodnews.doc" "\\server\share\mydir\goodnews.doc" "\\server\share\numbers.xls" "\\server\share\numbers.xls" "c:\foo\MyFolder" "c:\foo\MyFolder" "/Mailbox Account/Inbox/'Re: Hello!'" "/Mailbox Account/Inbox/'Re: Hello!'"

Description: This is the user-friendly display path to the item. The format of the string should be tailored such that the name comes first, to optimize for a narrow viewing column.
If the item is a file, the value excludes the file extension, and includes localized names if they are present. If the item is a message, the value includes the System.ItemNamePrefix.
To parse an item path, use System.ItemUrl or System.ParsingPath.
Example values:
If the path is... The property value is... ----------------- ------------------------ "c:\foo\bar\hello.txt" "hello (c:\foo\bar)" "\\server\share\mydir\goodnews.doc" "goodnews (\\server\share\mydir)" "\\server\share\folder" "folder (\\server\share)" "c:\foo\MyFolder" "MyFolder (c:\foo)" "/Mailbox Account/Inbox/'Re: Hello!'" "Re: Hello! (/Mailbox Account/Inbox)"

Description: This is the canonical type of the item and is intended to be programmatically parsed.
If there is no canonical type, the value is VT_EMPTY.
If the item is a file (ie, System.FileName is not VT_EMPTY), the value is the same as System.FileExtension.
Use System.ItemTypeText when you want to display the type to end users in a view. (If the item is a file, passing the System.ItemType value to PSFormatForDisplay will result in the same value as System.ItemTypeText.)
Example values:
If the path is... The property value is... ----------------- ------------------------ "c:\foo\bar\hello.txt" ".txt" "\\server\share\mydir\goodnews.doc" ".doc" "\\server\share\folder" "Directory" "c:\foo\MyFolder" "Directory" [desktop] "Folder" "/Mailbox Account/Inbox/'Re: Hello!'" "MAPI/IPM.Message"

Description: This is the user friendly type name of the item. This is not intended to be programmatically parsed.
If System.ItemType is VT_EMPTY, the value of this property is also VT_EMPTY.
If the item is a file, the value of this property is the same as if you passed the file's System.ItemType value to PSFormatForDisplay.
This property should not be confused with System.Kind, where System.Kind is a high-level user friendly kind name. For example, for a document, System.Kind = "Document" and System.Item.Type = ".doc" and System.Item.TypeText = "Microsoft Word Document"
Example values:
If the path is... The property value is... ----------------- ------------------------ "c:\foo\bar\hello.txt" "Text File" "\\server\share\mydir\goodnews.doc" "Microsoft Word Document" "\\server\share\folder" "File Folder" "c:\foo\MyFolder" "File Folder" "/Mailbox Account/Inbox/'Re: Hello!'" "Outlook E-Mail Message"

Description: This always represents a well formed URL that points to the item.
To reference shell namespace items using shell APIs, use System.ParsingPath.
Example values:
Files: "file:///c:/foo/bar/hello.txt" "csc://{GUID}/..." Messages: "mapi://..."
Description: The keywords for the item. Also referred to as tags.
Type: Multivalue String -- VT_VECTOR | VT_LPWSTR (For variants: VT_ARRAY | VT_BSTR) Legacy code may treat this as VT_LPSTR.

Description: System.Kind is used to map extensions to various .Search folders. Extensions are mapped to Kinds at HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Explorer\KindMap The list of kinds is not extensible.
Type: Multivalue String -- VT_VECTOR | VT_LPWSTR (For variants: VT_ARRAY | VT_BSTR)
Description: This is the user-friendly form of System.Kind. Not intended to be parsed programmatically.
Description: The MIME type. Eg, for EML files: 'message/rfc822'.
Description: The CLSID of the name space extension for an item, the object that implements IShellFolder for this item
Description: SID of the user that owns the library.
Description: used to get the IBindCtx for an item for parsing
Type: Any -- VT_NULL Legacy code may treat this as VT_UNKNOWN.
Description: The shell namespace name of an item relative to a parent folder. This name may be passed to IShellFolder::ParseDisplayName() of the parent shell folder.

Description: This is the shell namespace path to the item. This path may be passed to SHParseDisplayName to parse the path to the correct shell folder.
If the item is a file, the value is identical to System.ItemPathDisplay.
If the item cannot be accessed through the shell namespace, this value is VT_EMPTY.
Description: The perceived type of a shell item, based upon its canonical type.
Description: The amount filled as a percentage, multiplied by 100 (ie, the valid range is 0 through 100).
Description: This is the user-friendly form of System.Priority. Not intended to be parsed programmatically.
Description: Indicates the users preference rating of an item on a scale of 1-99 (1-12 = One Star, 13-37 = Two Stars, 38-62 = Three Stars, 63-87 = Four Stars, 88-99 = Five Stars).
Description: This is the user-friendly form of System.Rating. Not intended to be parsed programmatically.
Description: This is the user-friendly form of System.Sensitivity. Not intended to be parsed programmatically.
Description: IShellFolder::GetAttributesOf flags, with SFGAO_PKEYSFGAOMASK attributes masked out.
Description: Who is the item shared with?
Type: Multivalue String -- VT_VECTOR | VT_LPWSTR (For variants: VT_ARRAY | VT_BSTR)
Description: What is the item's sharing status (not shared, shared, everyone (homegroup or everyone), or private)?
Description: Indicates the users preference rating of an item on a scale of 0-5 (0=unrated, 1=One Star, 2=Two Stars, 3=Three Stars, 4=Four Stars, 5=Five Stars)
Description: A data that represents the thumbnail in VT_CF format.
Description: Unique value that can be used as a key to cache thumbnails. The value changes when the name, volume, or data modified of an item changes.
Description: Data that represents the thumbnail in VT_STREAM format that GDI+/WindowsCodecs supports (jpg, png, etc).
Type: String -- VT_LPWSTR (For variants: VT_BSTR) Legacy code may treat this as VT_LPSTR.

summary.para: Description: The list of properties to show in the file operation conflict resolution dialog. Properties with empty values will not be displayed. Register under the regvalue of "ConflictPrompt".
Description: The list of properties to show in the content view mode of an item in the context of browsing. Register the regvalue under the name of "ContentViewModeForBrowse".
Description: The list of properties to show in the content view mode of an item in the context of searching. Register the regvalue under the name of "ContentViewModeForSearch".
Description: The list of properties to show in the listview on extended tiles. Register under the regvalue of "ExtendedTileInfo".

Description: The list of properties to show in the file operation confirmation dialog. Properties with empty values will not be displayed. If this list is not specified, then the InfoTip property list is used instead. Register under the regvalue of "FileOperationPrompt".

Description: The list of all the properties to show in the details page. Property groups can be included in this list in order to more easily organize the UI. Register under the regvalue of "FullDetails".
Description: The list of properties to show in the infotip. Properties with empty values will not be displayed. Register under the regvalue of "InfoTip".

Description: The list of properties that are considered 'non-personal'. When told to remove all non-personal properties from a given file, the system will leave these particular properties untouched. Register under the regvalue of "NonPersonal".
Description: The list of properties to display in the preview pane. Register under the regvalue of "PreviewDetails".
Description: The one or two properties to display in the preview pane title section. The optional second property is displayed as a subtitle. Register under the regvalue of "PreviewTitle".
Description: The list of properties to show in the infotip when the item is on a slow network. Properties with empty values will not be displayed. Register under the regvalue of "QuickTip".
Description: The list of properties to show in the listview on tiles. Register under the regvalue of "TileInfo".
Description: The list of properties to display in the XP webview details panel. Obsolete.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.PropertySystem.ShellProperties.PropertySystemSearch
member.summary: System.Search Properties

summary.para: Description: General Summary of the document.
Description: Hash code used to identify attachments to be deleted based on a common container url
Description: The contents of the item. This property is for query restrictions only; it cannot be retrieved in a query result. The Indexing Service friendly name is 'contents'.
Description: The entry ID for an item within a given catalog in the Windows Search Index. This value may be recycled, and therefore is not considered unique over time.
Description: The Datetime that the Windows Search Gatherer process last pushed properties of this document to the Windows Search Gatherer Plugins.

Description: When using CONTAINS over the Windows Search Index, this is the number of matches of the term. If there are multiple CONTAINS, an AND computes the min number of hits and an OR the max number of hits.

Description: If this property is emitted with a value of TRUE, then it indicates that this URL's last modified time applies to all of it's children, and if this URL is deleted then all of it's children are deleted as well. For example, this would be emitted as TRUE when emitting the URL of an email so that all attachments are tied to the last modified time of that email.

Description: Any child URL of a URL which has System.Search.IsClosedDirectory=TRUE must emit System.Search.IsFullyContained=TRUE. This ensures that the URL is not deleted at the end of a crawl because it hasn't been visited (which is the normal mechanism for detecting deletes). For example an email attachment would emit this property
Description: Query Focused Summary of the document.
Description: Query Focused Summary of the document, if none is available it returns the AutoSummary.
Description: Relevance rank of row. Ranges from 0-1000. Larger numbers = better matches. Query-time only.
Description: The identifier for the protocol handler that produced this item. (E.g. MAPI, CSC, FILE etc.)
Description: This property should be emitted by a container IFilter for each child URL within the container. The children will eventually be crawled by the indexer if they are within scope.

Description: This property is the same as System.Search.UrlToIndex except that it includes the time the URL was last modified. This is an optimization for the indexer as it doesn't have to call back into the protocol handler to ask for this information to determine if the content needs to be indexed again. The property is a vector with two elements, a VT_LPWSTR with the URL and a VT_FILETIME for the last modified time.
Type: Multivalue Any -- VT_VECTOR | VT_NULL (For variants: VT_ARRAY | VT_NULL)

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.PropertySystem.PropertyDescriptionFormatOptions
member.summary: Delineates the format of a property string.
member.remarks: Typically use one, or a bitwise combination of these flags, to specify the format. Some flags are mutually exclusive, so combinations like ShortTime | LongTime | HideTime are not allowed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.PropertySystem.PropertyDescriptionFormatOptions.None
member.summary: The format settings specified in the property's .propdesc file.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.PropertySystem.PropertyDescriptionFormatOptions.PrefixName
member.summary: The value preceded with the property's display name.
member.remarks: This flag is ignored when the hideLabelPrefix attribute of the labelInfo element in the property's .propinfo file is set to true.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.PropertySystem.PropertyDescriptionFormatOptions.FileName
member.summary: The string treated as a file name.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.PropertySystem.PropertyDescriptionFormatOptions.AlwaysKB
member.summary: The sizes displayed in kilobytes (KB), regardless of size.
member.remarks: This flag applies to properties of Integer types and aligns the values in the column.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.PropertySystem.PropertyDescriptionFormatOptions.RightToLeft
member.summary: Reserved.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.PropertySystem.PropertyDescriptionFormatOptions.ShortTime
member.summary: The time displayed as 'hh:mm am/pm'.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.PropertySystem.PropertyDescriptionFormatOptions.LongTime
member.summary: The time displayed as 'hh:mm:ss am/pm'.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.PropertySystem.PropertyDescriptionFormatOptions.HideTime
member.summary: The time portion of date/time hidden.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.PropertySystem.PropertyDescriptionFormatOptions.ShortDate
member.summary: The date displayed as 'MM/DD/YY'. For example, '3/21/04'.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.PropertySystem.PropertyDescriptionFormatOptions.LongDate
member.summary: The date displayed as 'DayOfWeek Month day, year'. For example, 'Monday, March 21, 2004'.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.PropertySystem.PropertyDescriptionFormatOptions.HideDate
member.summary: The date portion of date/time hidden.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.PropertySystem.PropertyDescriptionFormatOptions.RelativeDate
member.summary: The friendly date descriptions, such as "Yesterday".

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.PropertySystem.PropertyDescriptionFormatOptions.UseEditInvitation
member.summary: The text displayed in a text box as a cue for the user, such as 'Enter your name'.
member.remarks: The invitation text is returned if formatting failed or the value was empty. Invitation text is text displayed in a text box as a cue for the user, Formatting can fail if the data entered is not of an expected type, such as putting alpha characters in a phone number field.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.PropertySystem.PropertyDescriptionFormatOptions.ReadOnly
member.summary: This flag requires UseEditInvitation to also be specified. When the formatting flags are ReadOnly | UseEditInvitation and the algorithm would have shown invitation text, a string is returned that indicates the value is "Unknown" instead of the invitation text.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.PropertySystem.PropertyDescriptionFormatOptions.NoAutoReadingOrder
member.summary: The detection of the reading order is not automatic. Useful when converting to ANSI to omit the Unicode reading order characters.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.PropertySystem.PropertyDescriptionFormatOptions.SmartDateTime

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.PropertySystem.PropertyTypeOptions.IsQueryable
member.summary: This property is included in the list of properties that can be queried.
member.remarks: A queryable property must also be viewable. This influences whether the property shows up in the query builder UI. This value is set by the isQueryable attribute of the typeInfo element in the property's .propdesc file.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.PropertySystem.PropertyTypeOptions.CanBePurged
member.summary: Used with an innate property (that is, a value calculated from other property values) to indicate that it can be deleted.
member.remarks: Windows Vista with Service Pack 1 (SP1) and later. This value is used by the Remove Properties user interface (UI) to determine whether to display a check box next to an property that allows that property to be selected for removal. Note that a property that is not innate can always be purged regardless of the presence or absence of this flag.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.ShellThumbnailRetrievalOption
member.summary: Represents the different retrieval options for the thumbnail or icon, such as extracting the thumbnail or icon from a file, from the cache only, or from memory only.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.ShellThumbnailRetrievalOption.Default
member.summary: The default behavior loads a thumbnail. If there is no thumbnail for the current ShellItem, the icon is retrieved. The thumbnail or icon is extracted if it is not currently cached.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.ShellThumbnailRetrievalOption.CacheOnly
member.summary: The CacheOnly behavior returns a cached thumbnail if it is available. Allows access to the disk, but only to retrieve a cached item. If no cached thumbnail is available, a cached per-instance icon is returned but a thumbnail or icon is not extracted.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.ShellThumbnailRetrievalOption.MemoryOnly
member.summary: The MemoryOnly behavior returns the item only if it is in memory. The disk is not accessed even if the item is cached. Note that this only returns an already-cached icon and can fall back to a per-class icon if an item has a per-instance icon that has not been cached yet. Retrieving a thumbnail, even if it is cached, always requires the disk to be accessed, so this method should not be called from the user interface (UI) thread without passing ShellThumbnailCacheOptions.MemoryOnly.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.ShellThumbnailFormatOption
member.summary: Represents the format options for the thumbnails and icons.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.ShellThumbnailFormatOption.Default
member.summary: The default behavior loads a thumbnail. An HBITMAP for the icon of the item is retrieved if there is no thumbnail for the current Shell Item.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.ShellThumbnailFormatOption.ThumbnailOnly
member.summary: The ThumbnailOnly behavior returns only the thumbnails, never the icon. Note that not all items have thumbnails so ShellThumbnailFormatOption.ThumbnailOnly can fail in these cases.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.ShellThumbnailFormatOption.IconOnly
member.summary: The IconOnly behavior returns only the icon, never the thumbnail.
